titleStmt.title: [Photograph of large pit-features near the former site of the mid-18th century townhouse at Chota, taken in 1969] / [by Richard R. Polhemus]: a machine-readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Polhemus, Richard R.

availability.p: This work is the property of the McClung Museum, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Photograph of large pit-features near the former site of the mid-18th century townhouse at Chota, taken in 1969] / [by Richard R. Polhemus]
bibl.author: Polhemus, Richard
bibl.note: This is a photograph of large pit-features discovered near the former site of the mid-18th century Chota townhouse. Pits were dug by the Cherokees for burial purposes and for the storage of refuse. This excavation was conducted by the University of Tennessee in 1969 in anticipation of the flooding of the lower Little Tennessee River by the Tellico Dam Reservoir. The university worked under contract with the National Park Service and TVA. Principal investigator, Alfred K. Guthe. Field Director, J. Worth Greene.
Frank H. McClung Museum Photographic Collection

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

figure.figDesc: Large pit-features near the Chota townhouse, mid 18th century, excavated by the University of Tennessee, 1969, photograph by Richard R. Polhemus. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.

p.note: This document consists of one image only.
